column4: just searched for xorg.conf and came up empty. Anyone have any ideas on how to get the gui worknig after the nvidia drivers have rendered my nvidia 6 series gpu useless?
yeah there should be a thread somewhere either in the forums or on the web, did your machine get hosed after an update?
searched the forums already and tried the advice I could find. didn't work. And no, my machine was hosed form a fresh cd install...
what version of ubuntu youre trying and what type of machine you have: brand/model
using 10.10 with an HP media center m8100n. The thing ran 9.10 like a champ before I had to install XP for business...
seems like it's a known issue, what video card do you have?
using an nvidia geforce 6100 SE nforce 430
tucemix, it's listed in the supported products under the driver listing on the nvidia website
you can get into a terminal?
in the terminal on the offending machine now.
i'm not exactly a terminal wizard... what command would I use to do that.
basically -- youre going to reconfigure X so that you have a GUI -- then you install the nVidia drivers: http://www.cyberciti.biz/faq/ubuntu-linux-how-to-reconfigure-x-windows-system-xorg-server/
just tried it. No response. The on screen prompts that should have showed up didn't. Kinda strange...
you mean you tried reconfiguring X?? Or you cant get into a terminal?
